H0.text: The Moon revolving around Earth is the cause of Earth's cycle of night and day.

H1.text: Earth revolving around the Sun is the cause of the cycle of night and day on Earth.

H2.text: The Moon rotating on its axis is the cause of the cycle of night and day on Earth.

H3.text: Earth rotating on its axis is what causes the cycle of night and day on Earth.

A4.text: Earth rotates once in about 24 hours with respect to the Sun, but once every 23 hours, 56 minutes and 4 seconds with respect to other distant stars

A5.text: The length of the day increased by about 2.3 milliseconds per century since the 8th century BCE
